property.name: description
property.value: Signed offset from UTC presented in 15-minute increments. EST = -20, CST = -24 etc.

property.name: description
property.value: Bit aligned with alarms in iCon meter

property.name: description
property.value: Set if Power Fail Event alarms matter

property.name: description
property.value: Set if Under-Voltage Event alarms matter

property.name: description
property.value: Set if Over-Voltage Event alarms matter

property.name: description
property.value: Set if Power Fail Carryover alarms matter

property.name: description
property.value: Set if RTC Adjusted alarms matter

property.name: description
property.value: Set if Holiday Flag alarms matter

property.name: description
property.value: Set if DST Change alarms matter

property.name: description
property.value: Set if Tamper Flag alarms matter

property.name: description
property.value: Set if Zero Usage alarms matter

property.name: description
property.value: Set if Disconnect Error alarms matter

property.name: description
property.value: Set if Meter Reading Corrupted alarms matter

property.name: description
property.value: Set if Transmitter Overheat alarms matter

property.name: description
property.value: Update the RTC if it is this far away from the incoming time sync

property.name: description
property.value: If this is set, the device will action any DST changes. Clearing this will force the DST Active flag to zero.

property.name: description
property.value: When this is set, the LED will turn on for 14.5 seconds, then turn off for 0.5 seconds. This on/off pattern is repeated 20 times, for a total of 5 minutes. Before this pattern starts, the LED will blink on and off 5 times for its normal startup pattern. If a carrier message is received during the 5 minute pattern, the pattern will be cancelled.

property.name: description
property.value: When this is set, the disconnect does not require a button to be pressed to reconnect the meter. The normal mode of operation is with this cleared and the button must be pressed for a reconnect.

property.name: description
property.value: When this is set a disconnect command will use a demand limit threshold to determine when the use will be disconnected. The normal mode of operation will be with this cleared, which will cause an immediate disconnect when the command is received. If both this and Disconnect Cycling Mode are set then the Demand Limit mode takes precedence.

property.name: description
property.value: When this is set, a disconnect command will send a cycling disconnect command to the disconnect device.

property.name: description
property.value: If set then, attached MCT-410d Firmware is Rev E or later.

property.name: description
property.value: Setting this bit will enable daily reporting. *** Note: changing this bit will clear all saved Load Profile data ***

property.name: description
property.value: Used to determine the type of external meter being used for channel #3

property.name: text
property.value: Wired UI1204 (Touchread) Sensus or Badger Water Meter

property.name: text
property.value: Net Metering Mode Enabled. Reverse power for a pulse meter on channel #1

property.name: description
property.value: Indicates whether multiple electronic meters are attached.

property.name: description
property.value: Interval in minutes over which most recent demand is calculatd

property.name: description
property.value: Interval in minutes over which load profile values are kept. Valid values are 5, 15, 30, and 0

property.name: description
property.value: Interval in minutes over which voltage load profile values are kept. Valid values are 5, 15, 30, and 0

property.name: description
property.value: Interval over which demand is averaged over, in 15 second increments. 0 = disabled, 1 = 15 seconds, 2 = 30 seconds, ect.

property.value: Interval in minutes over which load profile values are kept. Valid values are 5, 15, 30, and 0

property.value: Interval in minutes over which load profile values are kept. Valid values are 5, 15, 30, and 0

property.name: description
property.value: Under Voltage Threshold, stored as a multiple of .1 volts. For example, 2200 = 220 volt.

property.name: description
property.value: Over Voltage Threshold, stored as a multiple of .1 volts. For example, 2200 = 220 volt.

property.name: description
property.value: Used to determine which type of meter will populate load profile channel 1

property.name: description
property.value: The channel of the attached meter. In the case of a pulse meter, this indicates which physical KYZ channel of the MCT-470â€™s daughter board the pulse meter is attached to. In the case of an electronic meter, this indicates which load profile channel of that electronic meter to retrieve.

property.name: description
property.value: Used to determine whether to use load profile interval 0 or 1 and is only relevant for pulse meters

property.value: Time the relay will remain closed in 250ms increments

property.name: description
property.value: Time the relay will remain closed in 250ms increments

property.name: description
property.value: Seconds between each read of the attached IED. In 15 second increments.

property.name: description
property.value: Table to use. Use caution when changing.

property.name: description
property.value: Set up DNP points for collection 1 read. DNP points are offset by 1, 0 is disabled. Values must be seperated by a space. For example: 1 2 3 4, or 0x01 0x02 3 4. There are 15 possible dnp points between Collection Binary A and Collection Binary B.

property.name: description
property.value: Set up DNP points for collection 2 read. DNP points are offset by 1, 0 is disabled. Values must be seperated by a space. For example: 1 2 3 4, or 0x01 0x02 3 4. There are 15 possible dnp points between Collection Binary A and Collection Binary B.

property.name: description
property.value: Set up DNP points for collection 1 read. DNP points are offset by 1, 0 is disabled. Values must be seperated by a space. For example: 1 2 3 4, or 0x01 0x02 3 4. There are 3 possible DNP points

property.name: description
property.value: Set up DNP points for collection 2 read. DNP points are offset by 1, 0 is disabled. Values must be seperated by a space. For example: 1 2 3 4, or 0x01 0x02 3 4. There are 3 possible DNP points

property.name: description
property.value: Set up DNP points for collection 1 read. DNP points are offset by 1, 0 is disabled. Values must be seperated by a space. There are 2 possible DNP points

property.name: description
property.value: Set up DNP points for collection 2 read. DNP points are offset by 1, 0 is disabled. Values must be seperated by a space. There are 2 possible DNP points

property.value: Second half of binary bytes, see binary byte 1a.
